intro: Tribonanthes keigheryi, commonly known as the Keighery's tribonanthe, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually blue or purple and bloom during the cooler months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
